intro: Linaria zargariana, commonly known as the Persian toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, while the flowers are arranged in loose racemes. Linaria zargariana is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy species suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
